dialogueTree.title: Primer Book: "You hold in your hand the colourful..."
dialogueTree.english: You hold in your hand the colourful primer. The title reads: "A Primer for Small Kids." There's a bear involved.
dialogueTree.polish: Trzymasz w ręce kolorowy podręcznik. Jego tytuł to „Elementarz dla małych dzieci”. Jakiś niedźwiedź jest w to wszystko zamieszany.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Ты трымаеш у руках каляровы падручнік. Яго назва — «Буквар для малых дзяцей». Нейкі мядзведзь замяшаны ва ўсім гэтым.

links.title: You: "Exactly what I need!"
Primer Book: "Mhm. This book will show you the sc..."
links.english: Mhm. This book will show you the score; get you oriented with those basic concepts you appear to be hazy on. The anthropomorphic bear will give you the *low-down* of your life...
links.polish: Mhm. Ta książka pokaże ci, co i jak. Pozwoli ci zorientować się w tych podstawowych konceptach, które ci nieco umknęły. Antropomorficzny niedźwiedź *objaśni ci* życie...
links.belarusian: Мгм. Гэтая кніга пакажа табе, што і як. Дазволіць табе разабрацца ў тых базавых канцэпцыях, якія крыху ўпусціў. Антрапаморфны мядзведзь *паясніць табе* жыццё...

links.title: You: "On what?"
Primer Book: "The alphabet."
You: "Flip through the pages."
Primer Book: "Every page has one word designating..."
links.english: Every page has one word designating one letter of the alphabet, with a faded illustration -- most of them are scientific and cultural principles. It goes as follows...
links.polish: Na każdej stronie widnieje rozpoczynające się na konkretną literę alfabetu słowo oraz wyblakła ilustracja – większość z nich przedstawia rozmaite prawidła naukowe i kulturalne. Prezentuje się to następująco...
links.belarusian: На кожнай старонцы знаходзіцца слова, якое пачынаецца з пэўнай літары алфавіта, і выцвілая ілюстрацыя – большасць з іх паказвае розныя навуковыя і культурныя правілы. Гэта выглядае наступным чынам...

links.title: You: "Let's do this."
Primer Book: "A is for Azimuth, B is for Boreas,..."
links.english: A is for Azimuth, B is for Boreas, C is for Cosign, D is for Diamat, E is for Ellips, F is for Flogiston, G is for Gamut.
links.polish: A jak Azymut, B jak Boreas, C jak Celsjusz, Ć jak Ćma, D jak Diamat, E jak Ellips, F jak Flogiston, G jak Gama.
links.belarusian: А як Азымут, Б як Бореас, В як Цэльсій, Г як Імша, Д як Дыямат, Е як Элiпс, Ж як Флагіст, З як Гама.

links.title: You: "Mmhm."
Primer Book: "H is for Homeboy, I is for Iikon, J..."
links.english: H is for Homeboy, I is for Iikon, J is for Jura, K is for Kollaps, L is for Laudanum, M is for Myriad, N is for Nadir, O is for Oreole, P is for Perihelion.
links.polish: H jak Hostel, I jak Iikon, J jak Jura, K jak Kollaps, L jak Laudanum, Ł jak Łopian, M jak Miriady, N jak Nadir, O jak Oreole, Ó jak Ówczesny, P jak Peryhelion.
links.belarusian: Г як Гасцініца, І як Ікон, Й як Юра, К як Калапс, Л як Лауданум, Л як Лапух, М як Мірады, Н як Надзір, О як Арэолы, Ў як Тойчасовы, П як Перыгель.

links.title: You: "Yeah!"
Primer Book: "Q is for Quasar, R is for Rhododend..."
links.english: Q is for Quasar, R is for Rhododendron, S is for Sinus, T is for Tricoleur, U is for Ultra, V is for Vector, W is for Warheit, X is for Xylophone, Y is for Ystävä, Z is for Zenith.
links.polish: R jak Rododendron, S jak Sinus, Ś jak Świat, T jak Tricoleur, U jak Ultra, W jak Warhei, Y jak Ystävä, Z jak Zenit, Ż jak Żyroskop, Ź jak Źrenica.
links.belarusian: Р як Родадэндрон, С як Сінус, С як Свет, Т як Трыколер, У як Ультра, В як Вархей, Y як Ystävä, З як Зеніт, Ж як Жыраскоп, З як Зрэнка.

links.title: You: "That's it?"
Primer Book: "That's it. You know the alphabet no..."
links.english: That's it. You know the alphabet now.
links.belarusian: І ўсё. Цяпер ты ведаеш алфавіт.

links.title: Conceptualization: "In what is called the IL -- the Int..."
links.english: In what is called the IL -- the International Language, developed by scientists from Graad in the Twenties! Sinus means 'Sign', for example.
links.polish: W JM – języku międzynarodowym, który opracowali w latach dwudziestych naukowcy z Graadu – słowo „sinus” oznacza na przykład „znak”.
links.belarusian: У JM – міжнароднай мове, распрацаванай у дваццатыя гады навукоўцамі з Града – слова «сінус» азначае, напрыклад, «знак».

links.title: You: "Nod stoically."
You: "No time."
links.belarusian: У мяне няма на гэта часу.

links.title: Primer Book: "Of course. Obviously you already *k..."
links.english: Of course. Obviously you already *know* all this. It's the alphabet. Who doesn't know the alphabet?
links.polish: Oczywiście. Przecież już to wszystko *wiesz*. To alfabet. A kto nie zna alfabetu?
links.belarusian: Вядома. Бо ты ўжо ўсё гэта *ведаеш*. Гэта алфавіт. А хто не ведае алфавіта?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You. You don't know the alphabet. B..."
links.english: You. You don't know the alphabet. But never mind.
links.polish: Ty. Ty nie znasz alfabetu. Ale nieważne.
links.belarusian: Ты. Ты не ведаеш алфавіту. Але не важна.

links.title: You: ""Kim, I know the alphabet now.""
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. I also know the alphabet.""
Esprit de Corps: "It is a very useful skill to have,..."
links.english: It is a very useful skill to have, he thinks. For all sorts of life-activities. Like reading, and...
links.polish: To bardzo przydatna wiedza – myśli. Przy rozmaitych czynnościach życiowych. Jak czytanie i...
links.belarusian: Гэта вельмі карысныя веды – думкі. Пры розных жыццёвых занятках. Як чытанне і...

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
